result.execSummary:
The defendant John E Malone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John E Malone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John E Malone in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant pleads guilty to count 1.
Court questions and finds guilty.

Court orders:
Court costs and DNA Surcharge 60 days to pay.

Order to Submit DNA Specimen form given to defendant.  Must provide specimen by  04/19/2016 between 1 & 5 p.m.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must report to Barron County Jail for fingerprinting between 1:00 PM and 5:00 PM on Thursday, March 3, 2016.

Defendant John E Malone in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for Public Defender.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
